_prev_prog_3.Description:
Rich Products Corporation - Buffalo Facility's ammonia refrigeration system contains equipment to minimize the potential of an ammonia release.  The facility has in place the following for the ammonia refrigeration system:  preventative maintenance procedures and records, ammonia alarm systems, ammonia detectors and ventilation system, process safety information tracking logs, equipment alarms for system shutdown capabilities, periodic leak and pressure testing, periodic visual inspections, control valves, refrigeration hand service valves for manual operation, solenoid valves, pressure relief valves, computer generated work orders for maintenance,  and hot work permits.

The facility's administrative procedures are as follows:  periodic training for associates, compliance audits, pre-startup safety checks, process hazard analysis to address what-if scenarios and the measures taken to mitigate a release,  screening of all contractors performing work on the ammonia refrigeration system per OSHA and USEPA regulations, emergency response plan and drills, emergency evacuation plan and drills, standard operating procedures, experienced operators, sprinkler system, and management of change procedures.

Compressors have the following safeguards:  pressure and temperature gauges on suction and discharge piping, high and low temperature cut out, high and low pressure cut out, high and low level oil alarms and cut out, high and low oil temperature alarms and cutouts, high and low oil pressure alarms and cut outs, oil temperature gauges, cooling pump alarm, and pressure relief valves.

Condensers have the following safeguards:  pressure relief valves, pressure gauges, water and cooling fans are interlocked with pressure sensors, high pressure cut outs, common sump for condensers, and water treatment vendor inspection occurs quarterly.

Pressure vessels have the following safeguards:  pressure relief valves, level column with level indicator and level sight glass (bull's-eye are encased), level controllers, and level cut outs on some of the pressure vessels.

Evaporators have the following safeguards:   ice thickness control on ice builders, pressure controls on ammonia supply, PLC controls on some units, PLC alarm results in automatic shutdown of fans on some units, high and low liquid level alarms and cut outs, temperature controls, liquid level gauge, pressure relief valves, high and low pressure alarms and cut outs, emergency stop switch, and pressure and temperature gauges on suction and discharge piping.

The air purger has the following safeguards:  pressure relief valve, and check valves.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Rich Products Corporation - Buffalo Facility (RPC-BF) produces non-dairy creamers, pudding, frozen dough, and food products which are frozen for shipment by using an ammonia refrigeration system.  The RPC-BF has two distinct and separate ammonia refrigeration systems at the facility and are referred to as the old and new ammonia refrigeration system.  Each system contains approximately 25,000 pounds of anhydrous ammonia which is liquified under pressure.
  
RPC-BF endeavors to eliminate accidents and health hazards to Associates, customers, and the community by having procedures to provide Associates educational training, safe working conditions, and the means to increase awareness of potential dangers both on and off the job. RPC-BF objective is to prevent unwanted releases of ammonia into locations that could potentially expose Associates and others to serious hazards.  An effective program requires a systematic approach to evaluating the entire system.  Workplace and process safety are major concerns to management and Associates alike.  The prevention and mitigation of unwanted releases of ammonia into locations that could expose Associates and the community to serious hazards is of primary concern.   

RPC-BF has developed this program in accordance with OSHA Title 29 CFR 1910.119, and the USEPA Title 40 CFR Part 68.  The program is designed to inform all Associates of the hazards of ammonia, procedures for the safe use of ammonia, and the steps taken for the safety of Associates in the event of a release or spill (i.e., emergency response plan, management of change procedures, preventative maintenance program, associate training, etc.).  In addition, Rich Products Corporation has generated "Rich Products Corporation Standards for Safety Performance" which outlines the corporate policy for safety policies, safety procedures, and sample programs to be implemented at each Rich Products Corporation Facility.  The RPC-BF facility has experienced operators that have

worked with the ammonia refrigeration system, in some cases, in excess of twenty years.  

The RPC-BF has not had an accidental release of ammonia over the last five years.

RPC-BF has an emergency response program written to comply with OSHA 29 CFR 1910.119 (n), OSHA 29 CFR 1910.120, and USEPA 40 CFR 68.95.  These regulations establish the parameters to be included in the ammonia refrigeration emergency response program.
